Central PMS team

Dragos Ilie

For CPMs, there also in the fact that communications managers end up to feel like “learning a factory” and creating internal guides for their teams; this means they tend to share what they are doing for, and they focus on some other feature when they have time on this case. CPMs are not in perfect control, and they add such multiple times.

Who are these comms managers?

Dragos Ilie

Also, from some customers, I've heard them saying “we've told this multiple times to others at your company”, which means they have been repeating concerns alone that have been addressed internally and sorted, but they are quite eager that before the case has been sort of fixed but hope they are hesitant in engaging new conversations, as they have a lack of trust in our process, and would like to get response that they can be comfortable here being heard in new features.

Who are these comms managers?

Dragos Ilie

They are like the system admin at some companies, MIT, Smith, Hammas, Choice Hotels and Custom Biologics said this directly at the morning mail example, even they can not meet active customers till they add some visit when they restart to set up focus on our CPMs document only. Other failing systems do they decided to speed up the process of engagement. Obviously, it's still very engaging.

content.title: Jive CoPilot - Educational Series Part 1
content.visibleText:
Hello | First name |

We are now starting to send educational videos to better address what you can learn about HubSpot. We've prepared and selected these videos based on the questions we get asked most. We hope everyone else can also benefit from this knowledge.

Today's video is about how we use your data when you use HubSpot. We understand that there were questions regarding data security, and we want to address these concerns even more explicitly and comfortably.

Watch the video below to learn more about our commitment to keeping your data secure and ensuring all new staff are being trained on our data.

How does CoPilot use your data?

content.title: Jive CoPilot - Educational Series Part 1
content.layoutDescription: Email content editor with text and image
content.visibleText:
Edit Text

Hello | First name |

We are now starting to send educational videos to better address the questions around CoPilot. We've prepared and selected these videos based on what you can learn about most swiftly. Everyone else can also benefit from this knowledge.

Today's video is about how we use your data when you use CoPilot. Understandably, there were concerns regarding data security, and we want to address these concerns to ensure everyone is informed and comfortable.

Watch the video below to learn more about our commitment to keeping your data secure and ensuring no AI is ever being trained on your data.

How does CoPilot use your data?

[Image: CS CoPilot displaying the power to filter video responses based on the user clicking on a checkbox. Other questions in the list remain clickable.]

activitySummary: The user is actively engaged in a chat with their team on Google Chat, specifically in the 'Central PMS team' space. The conversation revolves around communication managers and their roles in various companies. The user is discussing feedback from customers and the challenges faced by communication managers in engaging with new features. This indicates that the user is involved in team collaboration and addressing customer concerns.

The user is also working on an email campaign in HubSpot. The email titled 'Jive CoPilot - Educational Series Part 1' is being edited to include educational content about HubSpot's data usage and security practices. The user is customizing the email content, including text and images, to ensure it addresses common questions and concerns about data security. This shows the user's involvement in creating and managing email marketing campaigns.

The user briefly navigates to a new tab in Google Chrome, indicating a potential shift in focus or a need to access additional resources. The new tab shows the Google search page with quick access to various Google apps and recent documents from Google Drive. This suggests that the user might be preparing to search for information or access documents related to their current tasks.
aiUseSummary: There is no evidence of AI tools being used in the provided screenshots. The user is primarily engaged in team communication via Google Chat and email campaign management in HubSpot. There are no visible interactions with AI chat interfaces or AI-driven tools in the captured activities.
